meta.title: Operation of Inductively Coupled Plasma Spectrometer

sections.purpose: To describe the standard operating procedure for the operation of Inductively Coupled Plasma (ICP) Spectrometer for multi-element analysis and trace metal determination in pharmaceutical samples.
sections.scope: Applicable to ICP spectroscopy activities carried out in the Central Instrumentation.
procedure: Verify that argon gas supply has adequate pressure and all gas lines are properly connected.
Check that the chiller or cooling system is functioning and at proper temperature.
Ensure the peristaltic pump tubing is in good condition and properly installed.
Power ON the ICP spectrometer and initialize the control software.
Ignite the plasma torch and allow it to stabilize for at least 20-30 minutes.
Verify plasma stability by observing the flame and checking torch position.
Perform wavelength calibration and optimization using standard reference solutions.
Set the analytical wavelengths for the elements to be analyzed.
Prepare blank solutions, calibration standards, and quality control samples.
Aspirate blank solution and perform background correction and zeroing.
Aspirate calibration standard solutions in ascending order of concentration.
Verify linearity of calibration curves and correlation coefficients for all elements.
Analyze quality control samples to confirm system performance and accuracy.
Aspirate sample solutions and record emission intensities for target elements.
Rinse the system with dilute acid between samples to prevent carryover.
Calculate concentrations using calibration curves and apply dilution factors if needed.
After analysis, aspirate dilute acid and then deionized water for thorough cleaning.
Extinguish the plasma following proper shutdown procedure.
Power OFF the instrument and document all analytical data in the record.
precautions: Always ensure adequate argon gas supply before starting the analysis.
Never look directly at the plasma as it emits intense UV radiation.
Ensure proper ventilation to exhaust plasma gases safely.
Use only ICP-grade or ultrapure argon gas for stable plasma operation.
Prepare samples in dilute acid matrix to prevent clogging and memory effects.
Check nebulizer and spray chamber for salt deposits regularly.
Wear appropriate PPE including lab coat, gloves, and UV-protective eyewear.
Handle acid solutions with care and dispose of waste as per chemical waste protocols.
Perform regular maintenance of torch, nebulizer, and peristaltic pump tubing.
